def sqrt(number):       start = 0     end = number     ans = 1       # Calculate the integral part of square root     while start <= end:         mid = (start + end) // 2           if mid**2 == number:             ans = mid             break           # Increment start if integral part lies on right side of the mid         if mid**2 < number:             start = mid + 1             ans = mid           # Decrement end if integral part lies on the left side of the mid         else:             end = mid - 1       # Calculate the fractional part of square root     increment = 0.1     while ans**2 != number:         while ans**2 <= number:             ans += increment              # Do stuff           ans -= increment         increment /= 10       return ans  sqrt(2)

data.sampled: False. The code will stop after the first iteration when the while loop checks if `node` is not `None`, and assigns `head` to `node`. Then, the second iteration of the while loop will assign a new value to `node` and the loop will continue to push nodes back into the list while `node` is not `None`. However, the `pop_first()` method will still return the first node in the list for any subsequent iterations, so the loop will eventually come to a stop once there are no more nodes in the list.

prompt.content: You have to determine if a given block of code will run in forever in an infinite loop, or if it will stop. Only answer with True if it will run forever, and only with False if it stops

class Node:      def __init__(self):         self.next = None      class LinkedList:      def __init__(self):         self.head = None         self.tail = None      def push_back(self, node):         if self.head is None:             self.head = node             self.tail = node         else:             self.tail.next = node             self.tail = node          def pop_first(self):         if self.head is None:             return None         else:             head = self.head             self.head = self.head.next             return head 			 linked_list = LinkedList() node = Node() while node is not None:     linked_list.push_back(node)     node = linked_list.pop_first()      # Do stuff

int ReadVariableLengthInt(byte[] data, ref int index) {     int value = 0;     while (index < data.Length)     {         int b = data[index];         if ((b & 0x80) == 0)         {             return (value << 7) | b;         }         value = (value << 7) | (b & 0x7F);         index++;     }     return value; }
